intro: Centaurium capitatum, commonly known as the common centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, erect stems and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom from June to August. Centaurium capitatum is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
